titlepage.titleproper: Finding aid for the Ralph M. Hodnett papers
titlepage.author: Finding aid created by Emily Mathay, April 2020

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Ralph M. Hodnett papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Donated by Paul O. Germann (donor no. 7792)

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright status is unknown. Patrons are responsible for determining the appropriate use or reuse of materials.

bioghist.p: Ralph M. Hodnett was an officer in the U.S. Army Engineers during World War I.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of reminiscences (written about 1919?) of Hodnett's experiences in France during World War I; a diary (1913-1918) of his father (name unknown), an army clerk in the Philippines and later along the Mexican border, a genealogical notebook of the Oram family, and photographs. The photographs are portraits, some of which are in uniform.

controlaccess.subject: Soldiers -- United States.
World War, 1914-1918 -- Personal narratives, American.
Soldiers -- American.
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army -- History -- Punitive Expedition into Mexico, 1916.

scopecontent.p: Reminiscence (written about 1919?) of his experiences in France during World War I; diary (1913-1918) of his father (name unknown) an army clerk in the Philippines and later along the Mexican border; genealogical notebook of the Oram family; and photographs.
